text: This page is an overview of Poland at the UCI Track Cycling World Championships. == List of medalists == This a list of Polish medals won at the UCI Track World Championships. {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !style="width:5em"| Medal !style="width:15em"| Championship !style="width:15em"| Name !style="width:15em"| Event |- | || || Waclaw Latocha || Men's 1 km time trial |- | || || Janusz Kierzkowski || Men's 1 km time trial |- | || || Janusz Kierzkowski || Men's 1 km time trial |- | || || Benedykt Kocot Andrzej Bek|| Men's tandem |- | || || Janusz Kierzkowski || Men's 1 km time trial |- | || || Benedykt Kocot Janusz Kotlinski|| Men's tandem |- | || || Janusz Kierzkowski || Men's 1 km time trial |- | || || Benedykt Kocot Janusz Kotlinski|| Men's tandem |- | || || Jan Faltyn || Men's points race |- | || || Ryszard Konkolewski Zbigniew Piątek|| Men's tandem |- | || || Ryszard Dawidowicz Marian Turowski Leszek Stępniewski Andrzej Sikorski || Men's team pursuit |- | || || Lech Piasecki || Men's individual pursuit |- | || || Grzegorz Krejner || Men's 1 km time trial |- | || || Rafał Ratajczyk || Men's points race |- | || || Rafał Ratajczyk || Men's scratch |- | || || Katarzyna Pawłowska || Women's scratch |- | || || Katarzyna Pawłowska || Women's scratch |- | || || Katarzyna Pawłowska || Women's scratch |- | || || Katarzyna Pawłowska || Women's points race |- | || || Małgorzata Wojtyra || Women's individual pursuit |- | || || Adrian Tekliński || Men's scratch |- | || || Wojciech Pszczolarski || Men's points race |- | || || Szymon Sajnok || Men's omnium |} Sources ==Most successful Polish competitors== {| class="wikitable" ! Championships |- | Katarzyna Pawłowska || 3 gold, 1 silver, 0 bronze || 2012 Melbourne – Women's scratch 2013 Minsk – Women's scratch 2016 London – Women's points race 2014 Cali – Women's scratch |- | Benedykt Kocot || 2 gold, 0 silver, 1 bronze || 1975 Rocourt – Men's tandem 1976 Monteroni di Lecce – Men's tandem 1974 Montreal – Men's tandem |- | Janusz Kotlinski || 2 gold, 0 silver, 0 bronze || 1975 Rocourt – Men's tandem 1976 Monteroni di Lecce – Men's tandem |- | Janusz Kierzkowski || 1 gold, 1 silver, 2 bronze || 1973 San Sebastián – Men's 1 km time trial 1969 Antwerp – Men's 1 km time trial 1974 Montreal – Men's 1 km time trial 1975 Rocourt – Men's 1 km time trial |- | Rafał Ratajczyk || 0 gold, 1 silver, 1 bronze || 2006 Bordeaux – Men's points race 2007 Palma de Mallorca – Men's scratch |} ===Medals by discipline=== updated after the 2017 UCI Track Cycling World Championships {|class="wikitable sortable" border="1" style="text- align:center; font-size:90%;" |- !style="width:15:em;"|Event |style="background:gold; width:4.5em; font-weight:bold;"|Gold |style="background:silver; width:4.5em; font-weight:bold;"|Silver |style="background:#cc9966; width:4.5em; font-weight:bold;"|Bronze !style="width:4.5em;"|Total |- |align=left| Women's scratch || 2 || 1 || 0 || 3 |- |align=left| Men's tandem || 2 || 0 || 2 || 4 |- |align=left| Men's 1 km time trial || 1 || 2 || 3 || 6 |- |align=left| Men's scratch || 1 || 0 || 1 || 2 |- |align=left| Women's points race || 1 || 0 || 0 || 1 |- |align=left| Men's individual pursuit || 1 || 0 || 0 || 1 |- |align=left| Men's points race || 0 || 2 || 1 || 3 |- |align=left| Women's individual pursuit || 0 || 1 || 0 || 1 |- |align=left| Men's team pursuit || 0 || 1 || 0 || 1 |- ! Total !!8 !! 7!! 7!! 22 |} ==2015 UCI Track Cycling World Championships== Poland competed at the 2015 UCI Track Cycling World Championships in Saint-Quentin-en-Yvelines at the Vélodrome de Saint-Quentin-en-Yvelines from 18–22 February 2015. A team of 14 cyclists (6 women, 8 men) was announced to represent the country in the event. ==Results== ===Men=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !Name !Event !Result !Rank |- | Damian Zieliński || Men's sprint || 9.905 (Q), ||align=center|21 |- | Mateusz Lipa || Men's sprint || 10.100||align=center|31 |- | Kamil Kuczyński || Men's 1 km time trial ||1:01.583||align=center|10 |- | Adrian Tekliński || Men's scratch ||||align=center|16 |- | Wojciech Pszczolarski || Men's points race ||5 points||align=center|14 |- | Krzysztof Maksel || Men's keirin ||||align=center|12 |- | Kamil Kuczyński || Men's keirin ||||align=center|25 |- | Krzysztof Maksel Rafał Sarnecki Damian Zieliński || Men's team sprint ||43.481||align=center|7 |} Sources ===Women=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !Name !Event !Result !Rank |- | Eugenia Bujak || Women's individual pursuit ||3:39.636||align=center|13 |- | Edyta Jasińska || Women's individual pursuit ||3:44.505||align=center|16 |- | Katarzyna Pawłowska || Women's points race ||1 points||align=center|16 |- | Małgorzata Wojtyra || Women's omnium ||58 points||align=center|19 |- | Katarzyna Pawłowska || Women's scratch ||||align=center|16 |- | Katarzyna Pawłowska Małgorzata Wojtyra Eugenia Bujak Natalia Rutkowska || Women's team pursuit ||4:34.620||align=center|10 |} Sources == 2016 UCI Track Cycling World Championships == Poland competed at the 2016 UCI Track Cycling World Championships at the Lee Valley VeloPark in London, United Kingdom from 2-4 March 2016. A team of 17 cyclists (7 women, 10 men) was announced to represent the country in the event. ==Results== ===Men=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !Name !Event !Result !Rank |- | Damian Zielinski|| Men's sprint || ||align=center|4 |- | Kamil Kuczynski|| Men's sprint || ||align=center|13 |- | Krzysztof Maksel|| Men's 1 km time trial ||01:01.597||align=center|4 |- | Mateusz Lipa|| Men's 1 km time trial ||01:02.908||align=center|13 |- | Rafal Sarnecki|| Men's keirin ||||align=center|17 |- | Adrian Teklinski|| Men's scratch ||||align=center|19 |- | Wojciech Pszczolarski|| Men's points race ||-19 points||align=center|14 |- | Grzegorz Drejgier Rafal Sarnecki Krzysztof Maksel || Men's team sprint ||43.751||align=center|8 |} Sources ===Women=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !Name !Event !Result !Rank |- | Malgorzata Wojtyra|| Women's individual pursuit ||03:34.519 (q), 03:41.904 (f)||align=center|2 |- | Natalia Rutkowska|| Women's scratch || ||align=center|13 |- | Katarzyna Pawlowska|| Women's points race ||15 points ||align=center|1 |- | Katarzyna Pawłowska Eugenia Bujak Edyta Jasińska Natalia Rutkowska|| Women's team pursuit ||04:29.239 (q), 04:27.165 (f)||align=center|7 |} Sources ==See also== * Australia at the UCI Track Cycling World Championships * Cuba at the UCI Track Cycling World Championships * Netherlands at the UCI Track Cycling World Championships ==References== Category:Nations at the UCI Track Cycling World Championships Category:Poland at cycling events
